intro: Descurainia nuttallii, commonly known as Nuttall's tansy, is an annual flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, disturbed soils and can be found in prairies and along roadsides. Its seeds are small and contain compounds that have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
